item.name: Apple of Youth [2024]
item.text:
This divine boon of nature is normally kept in a secret garden, away from the prying eyes of mortals, bestowed only upon a select few who have performed a great service to the gods. Upon consuming this apple, you no longer age or suffer the effects of old age. Additionally, any detrimental condition or curse currently afflicting you, immediately ends.
Source: Zamanora: Ballad of the Witch p. 192 (Homebrew)

item.name: Blue Balaur Stone [2024]
item.text:
Legend has it that the saliva of a mythical Balaur condensates into precious gemstones that bestow incredible magical properties. Few are those who can boast having witnessed such a wondrous creation, and even fewer are those to have possessed it. Yet none can truly tell why these magnificent gems feature different colors and properties. Some speculate that they vary according to the age of the Balaur that produced them or what it had recently feasted upon. Others trust a legend, which dictates that they gain their color depending on the phase of the moon, when its light first shone upon them. A skilled artisan can attach such a gemstone to a weapon, armor, shield, or other item, in order to enhance its properties. Only a single Balaur gemstone can be attached to a piece of equipment.
A blue Balaur gemstone strengthens and wards from harm.
Weapon. The weapon ignores Resistance to Bludgeoning, Slashing and Piercing damage.
Armor or Shield. Any damage dealt to you is reduced by 2. After reducing 10 points of damage in this way, the stone's magic becomes inert until the next dawn.
Other. Once before every new dawn, upon failing a saving throw, you may choose to roll it again. You must use the new roll.
Source: Zamanora: Ballad of the Witch p. 192 (Homebrew)

item.name: Bowl of Divine Offering [2024]
item.text:
This ornate bowl can be used to commit offerings to the gods, imploring their favor and acting as a conduit between mortalkind and the divine. Once before every new dawn, you can fill this bowl with water, honey or blood to cast the Augury spell. When casting Augury in this way, depending on the omen yielded by the spell and the substance that was used to fill the bowl, the gods bestow a corresponding boon or curse, as presented in the following table:
Bowl of Divine Offering: Omen | Water | Honey | Blood Weal | The water turns into a dose of Holy Water | Consuming a portion of honey causes the effects of Bless for 24 hours (the bowl contains 3 portions) | The creature who offered its blood gains the effects of False Life (at Level 5) Woe | The water turns into a dose of Poison, Basic | Consuming a portion of honey causes the effects of Bane for 24 hours (the bowl contains 3 portions) | The creature who offered its blood is afflicted by a Level 5 curse or lower for 24 hours, determined at random amongst the effects of Bestow Curse (see Chapter III: Folklore Magic) Weal and Woe | The effect is unknown; upon using the water, roll a d20. On 1 to 10, it has the effects of Weal. On 11 to 20, it has the effects of Woe | The effect is unknown; upon consuming a portion of honey, roll a d20. On 1 to 10, it has the effects of Weal. On 11 to 20, it has the effects of Woe | The creature who offered its blood gains the effects of False Life (at Level 5). When the Temporary Hit Points granted by the spell are lost, it suffers the effects of Woe
Source: Zamanora: Ballad of the Witch p. 193 (Homebrew)

item.name: Buckler of Annealing [2024]
item.text:
This shield has 4 charges and regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, as a Reaction to a melee weapon attack that misses you by a result of 1 or 2 lower than your AC, you can spend 1 charge to cast Heat Metal (save DC 14) at the attacker's wielded weapon. Alternatively, you can spend 1 charge as part of a Shove action to cast Heat Metal at the target's worn armor or shield. When casting Heat Metal in this way, its effects last until the start of your next turn and do not require you to maintain Concentration. Creatures made of manufactured metal are eligible targets for this shield's properties, while weapons, armors and shields not made of such, ignore its effects.
Utilize Action to Don or Doff.
Proficiency: shield Source: Zamanora: Ballad of the Witch p. 194 (Homebrew), Player's Handbook p. 144

item.name: Duskbane [2024]
item.text:
You gain a +1 on attack and damage rolls made using this silvered magic weapon.
On a hit, the dagger deals an extra 2d4 Radiant damage to shape-shifted creatures (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example). Additionally, when a shape-shifted creature is dealt damage by this dagger, it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the damage dealt by this dagger.
Nick (Mastery): When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action in· stead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
Finesse: When making an attack with a Finesse weapon, use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: When you take the Attack action on your turn and. attack with a Light weapon, you can make one extra attack as a Bonus Action later on the same turn. That extra attack must be made with a different Light weapon, and you don't add your ability modifier to the extra attack's damage unless that modifier is negative. For example, you can attack with a Shortsword in one hand and a Dagger in the other using the Attack action and a Bonus Action, but you don't add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll of the Bonus Action unless that modifier is negative.
Thrown: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack, and you can draw that weapon as part of the attack. If the weapon is a Melee weapon, use the same ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls that you use for a melee attack with that weapon.
Proficiency: simple, dagger Source: Zamanora: Ballad of the Witch p. 194 (Homebrew)

item.name: Grim Harvester [2024]
item.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. This weapon has the Finesse property. On a hit, the sickle deals an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage. In addition, by using a Bonus Action, you can awaken the sinister energies that dwell within this weapon for 1 minute. For the duration, wounds inflicted by this weapon harvest the essence of the target's soul, reducing its Hit Point maximum by an amount equal to the damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a Long Rest. The target dies if this property reduces its Hit Point maximum to 0. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.
Nick (Mastery): When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action in· stead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

For example, you can attack with a Shortsword in one hand and a Dagger in the other using the Attack action and a Bonus Action, but you don't add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll of the Bonus Action unless that modifier is negative.
